'Layer de la Haye' (often spelled 'Layer-de-la-Haye'; locally known just as
'Layer') is a small village of around 2,000 people near Colchester in Essex,
England. While its historical significance is limited, it nevertheless has an
interesting and varied history, and today it offers vibrant and community and
beautiful landscapes.
